title: I took my car off road ... (Oops)

comments.comment: Seeing Pewds just doing whatever the fuck he wants is so heartwarming, we love seeing you happy pewds.
as much as i love Felix's gaming content, THIS entire era has just been pure euphoria. Seeing him being able to actually enjoy himself fills me with joy
I love the retired arc of Pewds. Getting to watch him rest and enjoy the fruits of his labor will always be S tier
Kind of insane how this channel has evolved from memes to Minecraft to cars and how pewds actually doing. It's change is insane and the channel is even better

marzia : "im going out to eat cake with my friend"
felix : "im going out offroad on a stock car with the boys"
Pewdiepie and the scientists of Youtube is not the collab I was expecting, but it sure is a welcomed one!
It would be cool to see someone invite PewDiePie out to a drift track and teach him how to drift.
Love seeing Pewds so happy
I can’t believe cheering Felix on while he’s towing his car out of a mud pit through a phone screen has been the highlight of my day
Felix slowly succumbing to car culture, and in one of the most perfect places to do so, is the vibe I never knew I was missing. That looked like such a blast!
when you guys were at the back seat just laughing and enjoying yourselves. it really made my day, didnt laugh that much in a while, felt like a kid again. thanks pewds
More videos of Pewds finally indulging himself after countless years of work!
I smiled like a fool entire video, seeing pewds happy makes me happy
The giggling of all the grown men in the car is actually adorable and heartwarming.

Seeing Pewdiepie do these super random and awesome things is epic. Growing up as a kid watch Friday with Pewdiepie and now this is truly awesome seeing him do this. Super happy to see you having a wild experience.

Ive cleared land out at my parents property and ive gotten many machines and vehicles stuck in mud throughout my life.....   but it was still entertaining watching someone go through it with a unique perspective.  To us it was another day, to Pewds?  A huge memory.
Pewds is 100% becoming a car guy
This vid is the definition of "boys will be boys". The excited giggles of grown men having a blast together is so heartwarming!
Felix slowly becoming a car guy is honestly the best feeling it really is. Now we just gotta get him to do drifting
9:01 glad to see Slippy's relative was there to help. Such a legend helping get Pewd's car out

Getting to see Felix just have fun and let loose after a harsh 10+ years of daily YouTube uploads is honestly heartwarming. I am so happy to see him not stressing out and just simply living life at his pace. I am super happy to have been born in the same lifetime as Pewds.
Seeing Felix live out his dreams in Japan and just have fun is so wholesome and enjoyable
Having fun with cars is something I really love so to see you dip your toe into the car community was awesome to see, glad you had a good time with your buds, that’s what it’s all about
Pewds doing car stuff. In freaking Japan. My heart is happy.
I love that everyone else is just as happy seeing him do what he truly wants to on his channel, I feel like I can feel how we his audience have matured and grown along with him. It’s nice

Hi Felix, Experienced off-roader and over-lander here, here are some tips!

A good piece of advice is always drive with your thumbs out on the wheel and not curled in, since driving up and down could cause a sudden turn and it can easily break your thumbs. Also, you need to install proper recovery points made from certain mild steel for doing recovery like that - they are designed to take the kind of load like a full sized Toyota or land rover stuck in deep mud. You also will not lose your bumper again (lol). Lastly, I would say do not stand close to recovery rope when towing the car out from being stuck - they can snap and it will injure whoever is close by. Also, I would recommend getting a longer and stronger recovery rope (I presume this was your first time, so you did not have certain pieces of equipment). 

Lastly, it is a good idea to deflate your tyres to a lower pressure, so that sharp stones and rocks do not cut the tyres and also it provides better traction since there is more surface area in contact with the ground. 

I loved the video!

Love you pewds! <3
As a Aussie that love 4 wheel driving, this makes me so happy. Never thought that that I’ll be seeing Pewdiepie driving through bog holes. Haha need to see a 4wd24/7 Calab one day.
Never did i ever dream Pewds and William would collab to do something fun like that
I think we are witnessing Pewds slowly becoming a car enthusiast and i love it.
I love these videos where it’s like we are part of the family and getting to see him just do normal stupid stuff

When I was in 6th grade my father and I took a trip to Moab Utah and went zip lining. As we were in the main office of the building I heard the voice of the backyard scientist. At first I thought it was a video someone was watching but when I turned around it was him and his girlfriend. We ended up in the same group and we spent the entire afternoon together. We would have challenges on who could run backwards off the cliff the fastest. Now I’m a freshman in college, crazy to see him with pewdiepie now making awesome content like this. I found this in my recommendations
Ah, to see Felix being so carefree. What a lovely journey for this guy, we are so proud of him.
As someone who obsesses over cars, car culture, and history, it makes me so happy seeing you enjoy your Toyota the way they wanted you to when they designed it
This is my kinda content!
I’m literally all for Felix becoming a car guy, been watching back when he first made Amnesia and Penumbra videos !

PewDiePie slowly becoming a car guy is what keeps me going...

one of us one of us
i remember watching him play happy wheels and amnesia when i was in 3rd grade and now im watching him living life in japan as a senior in highschool...thank u for the years of great content man
Watching Poods enjoy his life with his wife and his dogies is such a bliss. After all, he's been through a lot of drama. I'm so glad he's contented with uploading videos he enjoys.
RIP front bummer... You will never be forgotten.

Well it wasn't your fault pewds, tying the strap to the bumper was where it all went wrong, it's always adviced to use a hard point on the car i.e any part that is fully welded to the chassis, like the towing hook for example. It is present in every car and it's fully welded to the car's chassis so it becomes a hard point. If you strap it to any other part of the car, that part will most likely just get ripped off, like it did here!
Dude what!!! I would have never thought I would see this crossover with my favorite YouTubers. And they actually looked like they had a really good time!
As someone who offroads toyotas and has been a fan for years, this is 100% content I'm here for. You should get some steel bumpers and rock sliders by the way!
That was very cool to see Felix having fun like that makes me happy to watch
What a humble guy, he didn't even use "ft Pewdiepie" in his title.

So literally stuff like this happens all the time when off-roading/mudding. Words of wisdom is if it gets stuck you had a good time. Also it’s always embarrassing but embrace the moment! Out of all the vlogs I’ve watched of yours this one hit home to me and it was just great to see this side
Seeing Felix so happy and genuinely enjoying life is so beautiful. I’m glad I’m able to watch along too
I love off-roading, mudding with four wheelers, and carving snow with snow machines. It’s so much fun. I was not expecting to see Felix doing this stuff but it was super cool to watch!

As a car guy, seeing Felix having fun with cars and using them for a purpose other than driving from A to B is honestly heartwarming.

Next up, something very Japanese - DRIFTING
I've binged all of these vlogs and I've loved every second. It's so nice to see Pewds happy and settled. I am BEYOND obsessed. Thank you for everything Felix.
The off-road driving event was a lot of fun. I still remember the screaming faces of the members. Thank you. please play again
I never would’ve expected Pewdiepie to get into off roading, it’s awesome

started watching pewd's video because of his horror games play through way back 2014, and now i am seeing him, marzia, maya, and edgar having their best and happiest life in japan!! this is the glow up i want!!
Pewds is now the embodiment of every drunk uncle at every family reunion I’ve been to
as someone who loves 4wding getting stuck can be so frustrating but ironically the best part sometimes. Learning to get yourself out can be heaps of fun! Glad you had an awesome time x
Imagine coming back to this channel after 5 years... Pewds is a car guy!
I love the cast of this video, it's all nerdy science geeks, offroading. this is my favorite thing
My whole life I’ve never been a car guy, but that changed recently when I got a off-roading Jeep Grand Cherokee. Seeing pewds go through close to the same story really warms my heart

Seeing you just have fun without any pressure of getting content out is very heartwarming, watching your vlogs makes me feel like we your audience have grown up with you, from edgy and hyper videos during my younger years and now more calm and relaxing videos during my adult years. will always support and keep watching - gab

I see it's a normal thing to be laughing super hard while driving in a situation like that ! Those are some great experiences and memories !
Felix becoming a car guy and using the car as its meant to be. I love the guy even more

As someone who frequently goes off roading/mudding in my truck and jeeps in the southern part of the United States (Alabama and Florida) … I never thought I’d see a group of guys clapping when completing a maneuver. Loved it. Also, getting the truck stuck in the mud first time out very nice  welcome to the club .

This type of content is heartwarming because it wasn't done for the sake of hype, like what we usually see in YouTube and social media. It was a fun memory with friends, which is what we enjoy about these Japan vlogs.
This is just pure heart warming and adorable I was clapping when the vehicle finally came out!
This is probably the best video I seen in a long time pewds make. Everything about it is genuine
This video makes me smile so much, u can just tell their having so much fun and their just giggling so much. the whole video is just so happy, even when they ruin the car

Felix may have lost his way and went off-road, but he never lost his smile and positive energy. Even when there are some little obstacles here and there, he’s still having fun, which is the most important thing.
So happy seeing you smile and have fun mate, you sound really content with life when you speak. Happy for you mate. Made me smile when you were smiling
This made me smile so much. It reminds me of off-roading around the local farms as a kid. Such an adrenaline rush. I'm so glad that Felix is having so much fun in life.

the part where the bumper came off made me choke on my way to work 
growing up watching him go through hard times while i was struggling made me feel less alone. watching him now after all the bs makes me feel hopeful for what can happen. thanks felix
If pewdiepie gets into cars and starts modding off road vehicles will be the best day of my life

pewdiepie: i dont understand people who get off-roading vehicles and live in the city, like just buy a normal car youll be much happpier.
also pewdiepie: goes off-roading one time while living in the city

Also can I point out that this video is about a Swedish person, who's married to an Italian, doing the most American thing possible, in Japan. It is the greatest culture crossover I've ever seen.

As an Aussie this was so awesome to see considering off-roading is HUGE in Australia as one of our beloved outdoor adventures. And cool enough, one of our favourite 4x4 cars is in fact the Toyota Land Cruiser which for those who don't know was what Felix was basically driving <3
Love this video as an Aussie from the middle of nowhere going off road is either really fricking fun or it’s the scariest thing you’ve ever done ️

Pewds living that retirement life. I love it soooooo much.

Felix's shoutout to William Osman is what made me a fan of all these guys and it was awesome to see them all together causing so much chaos, never would have expected this collab but so happy it happened and looked like a lot of fun.
it's so nice to see Felix getting into new hobbies and going all out on new experiences.
Felix being so excited while driving off road is so wholesome

This is the most controlled offroad experience and I love it for beginners. Makes it fun, safe and if anything goes wrong, it's easily fixable. Taking this really offroading would have so many variables.
I'm just happy that Pewds is having so much fun
This made me smile so much, I love this whole thing and I’m so very happy for you Felix!! We love you!!!!

If you go offroad without getting stuck then you did not have enough fun.
Keep a kinetic rope (snatch strap) in your 4x4 for next time you're stuck in the mud. Way easier to recover with that and less chance of damage. Way less chance. Also, get a proper tow mount installed on your chassis
